title: Deployment, Configuration, and Operational Runbook
summary: Deployment topology, configuration sources, secrets handling, and operational runbook notes.
description: Describe recommended deployment (single-node or k8s), environment variables, secret stores, backup/restore for Postgres, and minimal runbook for incident handling.

components.name: Config Management
components.responsibility: 12-factor env vars and optional config files documented in `settings.js`/`server.js`.

components.name: Secrets
components.responsibility: Use external secret manager in prod; local env for dev.

components.name: Backups
components.responsibility: Regular DB backups and tested restore steps.

interactions: App reads config at startup; migrations executed as part of deploy or CI rollout.
Monitoring/health endpoints used by orchestration system for liveness/readiness checks.
acceptance_criteria: Documentation covers how to deploy from main and v1.0.0 branches.
Health endpoints return expected status and can be used in probe configs.
Secrets and config practices documented for production use.
tasks: Add a short runbook in `docs/` for common ops tasks: backup/restore, rotate keys, handle migrations.
Document environment variables and required vault entries.
